Faculty                                                                                                                               Dean's Welcome                                                             Strategic Plan and Vision                                                             Why NYU Silver?                                                                                Campuses                                                             Donors & Development                                                             Publications                                                             Awards                                                             Dashboard                                                                                                                               Rockland                                                             Westchester                                                             Washington Square                                                             Shanghai                                                                                                              Home / About Silver                                                               Campuses                                                                                                                                                                                                               The School's three locations for study offer you convenience, flexibility, and a range of educational options. This allows you to study and have your field placement in the heart of the city or closer to home. Campuses are convenient to New Jersey, Rockland County, Westchester County, and Connecticut.   All programs offered by the School are available on the main campus of New York University at Washington Square .   The two-year MSW program along with a variety of full- and part-time options are available at our campuses in Rockland County , New York, and in Westchester County , New York.     The dual-degree programs in child development and health advocacy both require work at Sarah Lawrence College.   An MSW program at Shanghai and New York will start in fall 2015. Get Flash Player                                          Address     47 West 13th Street  New York, NY 10011     Resource Center and Contact Hours     Academic Year : Monday-Sunday 10am-10pm   Summer Hours: 9am - 9pm  Holiday hours may vary   Telephone number : (212) 998-4380     Getting Around       10 minute walk to Washington Square.   MTA Access:   One block from M5 and M7 bus stop on 6th Ave and 14th Street.   Two blocks from Union Square subway station for L, N, Q, R, 4, 5, 6 trains.   Half a block from the 14th Street station for F, M, & PATH trains.       The closest dining hall is on 14th st between 3rd and 4th Ave, Palladium Food Court.               Follow Us                                            About Senior House     Welcome to Senior House on W. 13th Street! Our vibrant close-knit community provides a great environment to get to know your neighbors, live independently, and establish a fantastic final year as an NYU student. We hope you will join us for the many educational and social opportunities hosted by our Building Leadership Team, Faculty Fellow in Residence, Resident Assistants, and our Hall Council At Thirteenth Street (HATS). Get the inside scoop on what is happening on our community by following us on Twitter , liking us on Facebook , and checking out our Blog . We are here to make your experience one that is memorable; so, let's make some memories together. Enjoy calling Senior House your home! Get Flash Player                                      Address   55 Clark Street  Brooklyn, NY 11201     Resource Center Contact & Hours   Academic Year:  Monday-Saturday, 10am-10pm & Sunday, 12pm-8pm  Holiday hours may vary  Telephone number: (212) 994-8813   Getting Around     Subway Access:   1 block to the Clark Street Station for the 2, 3 trains.   4 blocks to the High Street Station for the A, C trains   4 blocks to the Court Street Station for the R train.       Closest dining hall is the Jasper Cane Dining Center.     Resident Access & Guest Policy   St. George Clark Hall residents access the building and to their rooms via a key card, which is issued to them when they check in. This key card grants them access to the building, NOT their NYU ID.     The guest policy is different than at other NYU residence halls. If you're interested in having a guest, please check the complete guest policy .                                     About St. George Clark Hall   Located 1 block from the Clark Street 2/3 train, St. George Clark Hall is a recently renovated building, just one subway stop away from the financial district. Rooms are apartment style with a large, spacious community kitchen accessible to all student residents of the building. In the hall's cutting-edge, 8,300-square foot student community center, you can make dinner with friends, hold a study group in the library, watch a movie in the screening room, or play pool while catching a game on a flat screen TV. Furthermore, all residents are eligible for a complimentary membership to the Eastern Athletic Club, located next door.         Strategic Plan and Vision                                                             Why NYU Silver?                                                                                Campuses                                                             Donors & Development                                                             Publications                                                             Awards                                                             Dashboard                                                                                                                               Rockland                                                             Westchester                                                             Washington Square                                                             Shanghai                                                                                                              Home / About Silver                                                               Campuses                                                                                                                                                                                                               The School's three locations for study offer you convenience, flexibility, and a range of educational options. This allows you to study and have your field placement in the heart of the city or closer to home. Campuses are convenient to New Jersey, Rockland County, Westchester County, and Connecticut.   All programs offered by the School are available on the main campus of New York University at Washington Square .   The two-year MSW program along with a variety of full- and part-time options are available at our campuses in Rockland County , New York, and in Westchester County , New York.     The dual-degree programs in child development and health advocacy both require work at Sarah Lawrence College.   An MSW program at Shanghai and New York will start in fall 2015. Get Flash Player                                          Address     47 West 13th Street  New York, NY 10011     Resource Center and Contact Hours     Academic Year : Monday-Sunday 10am-10pm   Summer Hours: 9am - 9pm  Holiday hours may vary   Telephone number : (212) 998-4380     Getting Around       10 minute walk to Washington Square.   MTA Access:   One block from M5 and M7 bus stop on 6th Ave and 14th Street.   Two blocks from Union Square subway station for L, N, Q, R, 4, 5, 6 trains. Follow Us                                            About Senior House     Welcome to Senior House on W. 13th Street! Our vibrant close-knit community provides a great environment to get to know your neighbors, live independently, and establish a fantastic final year as an NYU student. We hope you will join us for the many educational and social opportunities hosted by our Building Leadership Team, Faculty Fellow in Residence, Resident Assistants, and our Hall Council At Thirteenth Street (HATS). Get the inside scoop on what is happening on our community by following us on Twitter , liking us on Facebook , and checking out our Blog . We are here to make your experience one that is memorable; so, let's make some memories together. Enjoy calling Senior House your home! Get Flash Player                                      Address   55 Clark Street  Brooklyn, NY 11201     Resource Center Contact & Hours   Academic Year:  Monday-Saturday, 10am-10pm & Sunday, 12pm-8pm  Holiday hours may vary  Telephone number: (212) 994-8813   Getting Around     Subway Access:   1 block to the Clark Street Station for the 2, 3 trains.   4 blocks to the High Street Station for the A, C trains   4 blocks to the Court Street Station for the R train.       Closest dining hall is the Jasper Cane Dining Center.     Resident Access & Guest Policy   St. George Clark Hall residents access the building and to their rooms via a key card, which is issued to them when they check in. This key card grants them access to the building, NOT their NYU ID.     The guest policy is different than at other NYU residence halls. If you're interested in having a guest, please check the complete guest policy .                                     About St. George Clark Hall   Located 1 block from the Clark Street 2/3 train, St. George Clark Hall is a recently renovated building, just one subway stop away from the financial district. Rooms are apartment style with a large, spacious community kitchen accessible to all student residents of the building. In the hall's cutting-edge, 8,300-square foot student community center, you can make dinner with friends, hold a study group in the library, watch a movie in the screening room, or play pool while catching a game on a flat screen TV. Furthermore, all residents are eligible for a complimentary membership to the Eastern Athletic Club, located next door.
